questions.text:
#### Q1. Which types of indexes are available in CosmosDB?

- %OPTION% range and spatial
- %OPTION% secondary and primary key
- %OPTION% secondary and spatial
- %OPTION% range and primary key

#### Q2. You want to connect a DynamoDB stream to AWS Lambda function. Which one of these object do you create?

- %OPTION% DynamoDB table
- %OPTION% DynamoDB trigger
- %OPTION% DynamoDB item
- %OPTION% DynamoDB index

#### Q3. To index a field that holds an array value in MongoDB, which index type do you create?

- %OPTION% partial
- %OPTION% sparse
- %OPTION% compound
- %OPTION% multikey

#### Q4. You want to test HBASE on your laptop using the fewest number of steps. What do you do?

- %OPTION% Set up Hadoop in pseudo-distributed mode.
- %OPTION% Set up HBASE in local mode.
- %OPTION% Set up HBASE in pseudo-distributed mode.
- %OPTION% Set up Hadoop in local mode.

#### Q5. You need to create a document database that supports database triggers. Which NoSQL database should you use?

- %OPTION% DynamoDB
- %OPTION% BigTable
- %OPTION% Redis
- %OPTION% MongoDB

#### Q6. What is recommended size for Redis keys?

- %OPTION% medium
- %OPTION% short
- %OPTION% single bit
- %OPTION% long

#### Q7. What does Redis use to sort the elements of a sorted set?

- %OPTION% Scores
- %OPTION% Ids
- %OPTION% Values
- %OPTION% Keys

#### Q8. You need to change the shard key of an existing MongoDB collection. What do you do?

- %OPTION% Dump the collection data, drop the collection, create a new collection and shard key, import the data.
- %OPTION% Add second shard key and drop the first shard key.
- %OPTION% Dump the collection data, drop the collection, presplit the data, create a new collection and shard key, import the data.
- %OPTION% Drop and recreate the shard key.

#### Q9. Polyglot storage means using multiple types of what in the same application?

- %OPTION% Security systems
- %OPTION% Database systems
- %OPTION% Storage systems
- %OPTION% Query systems

#### Q10. You need to implement the simplest possible scalable, in-memory cache for your AWS application. Which service do you select?

- %OPTION% Elasticache using Memcached.
- %OPTION% DynamoDB.
- %OPTION% DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX).
- %OPTION% Elasticache using Redis.

#### Q11. You are doing data modelling for Google BigTable. Which statement expresses if and when you should split entities across multiple rows?

- %OPTION% Keep all information for an entity in a single row. Store related entities in adjacent rows.
- %OPTION% Keep all information for an entity in a single row.
- %OPTION% Split entities across multiple rows if the entity data is over thousands of MBs, or if it does not need atomic updates and reads.
- %OPTION% Split entities across multiple rows if the entity data is over hundreds of MBs, or if it does not need atomic updates and reads.

#### Q12. Which two characteristics define Amazon Quantum Ledger Database?

- %OPTION% Key-value data model; transactionally consistent with ACID semantics.
- %OPTION% Document data model; transactionally consistent with ACID semantics.
- %OPTION% Key-value data model; transactions with tunable consistency.
- %OPTION% Document data model; transactions with tunable consistency.

#### Q13. You need to design the primary key for DynamoDB based on three attributes. What do you do?

- %OPTION% Designate all three fields as the primary key.
- %OPTION% Concatenate all three fields into one new field, then designate that new field as the primary key.
- %OPTION% Designate two fields of the three fields as the primary key.
- %OPTION% Concatenate two fields into one new field, then designate that new field and the remaining field as the primary key.

#### Q14. Which of these data types should you avoid in designing a Google Bigtable row key?

- %OPTION% multi-valued identifiers
- %OPTION% string identifiers
- %OPTION% timestamps
- %OPTION% frequently updated identifiers

#### Q15. Your startup is building a prototype that has an evolving schema. Your data will be eventually consistent. Your application is hosted in AWS. Which database do you choose?

- %OPTION% Neptune
- %OPTION% DocumentDB
- %OPTION% DynamoDB
- %OPTION% Amazon Aurora

#### Q16. You need to create a scalable database that allows you to share documents across authorized mobile clients in real time. What Google NoSQL database should you use?

- %OPTION% Memorystore
- %OPTION% Datastore
- %OPTION% Firebase
- %OPTION% Bigtable

#### Q17. You need to design security for DynamoDB to allow users read-only access to certain items and attributes in a table. What do you do?

- %OPTION% Use IAM roles.
- %OPTION% Use IAM policy conditions.
- %OPTION% Use a VPC endpoint.
- %OPTION% Use IAM policies.

#### Q18. Which statement is preferred Cypher code for Neo4j?

- %OPTION% MATCH (:Person)-->(:Card)-->(:Company) RETURN count(vehicle)
- %OPTION% Match (:Person)-->(:Car):(vehicle:Car)-->(:Company) RETURN count(vehicle)
- %OPTION% MATCH (:Person)-->(vehicle:Car)-->(:Company) RETURN count(vehicle)
- %OPTION% MATCH (:Person)-->(:Card), (vehicle:Car)-->(:Company) RETURN count(vehicle)

#### Q19. You need multi-item ACID transactions with snapshot isolation within a partition for your cloud-based application. Which NoSQL databse do you choose?

- %OPTION% Bigtable
- %OPTION% GraphDB
- %OPTION% DynamoDB
- %OPTION% Cosmos DB

#### Q20. You need to control your application's batch updates destination for your Bigtable multinode cluster. Which action do you take?

- %OPTION% Create a custom app profile to route batch updates.
- %OPTION% Create a custom app profile to route the batch update from that client.
- %OPTION% Update the default app profile to route the natch update from that client.
- %OPTION% Use the default app profile to route batch updates.

#### Q21. Your query to verify that your Redis key is configured to support expiring user information on a defined interval returns -2, What does this value indicate?

- %OPTION% The queried key value expired in the last two seconds.
- %OPTION% The queried key value exists, but has no associated expire value.
- %OPTION% The queried key value does not exist.
- %OPTION% There are two expired keys with this value.

#### Q22. You are designing a MongoDB schema to support queries that will include lookups. What should you do?

- %OPTION% Create an index on the key value used as the primary key.
- %OPTION% Create an index on the key value used as the foreign key.
- %OPTION% Create a multicolumn index on the key value used as the foreign key and the most unique column in the document.
- %OPTION% Create a multicolumn index on the key value used as the primary and also the foreign key.

#### Q23. What is the aggregation operator for a join concept in MongoDB?

- %OPTION% \$group
- %OPTION% \$match
- %OPTION% \$lookup
- %OPTION% \$project

#### Q24. For your mobile application, you need to select a Google cloud databse that can support compound, filtered document queries. Which do you choose?

- %OPTION% Cloud SQL
- %OPTION% Cloud Spanner
- %OPTION% Cloud Firestore
- %OPTION% Cloud Firebase

#### Q25. To bulk load data into Amazon Neptune, what do you do?

- %OPTION% Upload data to S3 VPC endpoint, Use the Neptune loader to load from s3 into your Neptune instance
- %OPTION% Ad data to a Kinesis stream, and use the Neptune loader to load from S# into your Neptune instance.
- %OPTION% Add data to a Kinesis stream, and create a Kinesis stream VPC endpoint. Use the Neptune loader to load from S3 into your Neptune instance.
- %OPTION% Upload data to S Use the Neptune loader to load from S3 into your Neptune instance.

#### Q26. You need to create a pub/sub server. Which database do you use?

- %OPTION% Neo4j
- %OPTION% Cassandra
- %OPTION% Redis
- %OPTION% MyS#### QL

#### Q27. SQL databases and NoSQL are which types of scalable?

- %OPTION% horizontally, infinitely
- %OPTION% vertically, horizontally
- %OPTION% vertically, infinitely
- %OPTION% horizontally, vertically

#### Q28. You need to create a scalable database that allows you to query data nodes and edges efficiently. What do you use?

- %OPTION% a relational database
- %OPTION% a columnstore database
- %OPTION% a document database
- %OPTION% a graph database

#### Q29. You are developing a model for a graph database. Your data will be moved from a relational database into Neo4j. Which of these transformations apply?

- %OPTION% Rows become labels: bales become nodes.
- %OPTION% Tables become labels: rows become nodes.
- %OPTION% Tables become collections: rows become items.
- %OPTION% Rows become collections: tables become items.

#### Q30. You need to execute a command for MongoDB that does NOT load values from the `.mongorc.js` file. What do you do ?

- %OPTION% Delete the .monorc.js file and restart mongo shell.
- %OPTION% Use the mongo shell to create a command with --norc option
- %OPTION% Rem all lines in the .mongorc.js file ad restart mongo shell.
- %OPTION% Use the mongo shell to create a command with --nodedefault option.

#### Q31. You need to store an unordered collection of name-value pairs with differing data types in DynamoDB. Which data type should you choose?

- %OPTION% map
- %OPTION% set
- %OPTION% list
- %OPTION% stack

#### Q32. Which statement retrieves an item from the MusicCollection table in DynamoDB?

- %OPTION% aws dynamodb query --table-name MusicCollection --key file://key.json
- %OPTION% aws dynamodb get-item --table-name MusicCollection --key file://key.json
- %OPTION% aws dynamodb select --table-name MusicCollection --key file://key.json
- %OPTION% aws dynamodb put-item --table-name MusicCollection --key file://key.json

#### Q33. Database availability is measured by which metric?

- %OPTION% the amount of service calls
- %OPTION% the number of minutes
- %OPTION% the amount of service costs
- %OPTION% the number of nines

#### Q34. You need to encrypt data at rest in DynamoDB. Which action do you take?

- %OPTION% You assign a default AWS encryption key to your table to encrypt data.
- %OPTION% You create an AWS encryption key and assign it to your table to encrypt data.
- %OPTION% None. Data is encrypted by default.
- %OPTION% You create an AWS encryption key and assign it to your database to encrypt data.

#### Q35. You need to generate a unique, sequential identifier for each value stored in a Redis cluster. What do you do?

- %OPTION% Implement a SortedSet object to generate a value.
- %OPTION% Use the GUID keyword to generate a value.
- %OPTION% Implement a List object to generate a value.
- %OPTION% Use the INCR keyword to generate a value

#### Q36. You want to return a list of all elements in two Redis sets. Which keyword do you use?

- %OPTION% smembers
- %OPTION% returnall
- %OPTION% sunion
- %OPTION% sismember

#### Q37. Which method shows you whether MongoDB uses any indexes when running a query, and how the indexes are used?

- %OPTION% detailQueryExecution()
- %OPTION% showPlan()
- %OPTION% explain()
- %OPTION% describe()

#### Q38. Which statement accurately describes global secondary indexes in DynamoDB?

- %OPTION% The global secondary indexes in DynamoDB are consistent, and are not guaranteed to return correct results.
- %OPTION% The global secondary indexes in DynamoDB are transactionally consistent, and are guaranteed to return correct results.
- %OPTION% The global secondary indexes in DynamoDB are partially consistent, and are not guaranteed to return correct results.
- %OPTION% The global secondary indexes in DynamoDB are eventually consistent, and are not guaranteed to return correct results.

[reference link:](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35414372/dynamodb-consistent-reads-for-global-secondary-index)

#### Q39. Which command do you use to add a value to a Redis stream named mystream?

- %OPTION% ADD mystream \* sensor-id 1234 temperature 19.8 1518951480106-1
- %OPTION% UPDATE mystream \* sensor-id 1234 temperature 19.8 1518951480106-3
- %OPTION% XADD mystream \* sensor-id 1234 temperature 9.8 1518951480106-0
- %OPTION% INSERT mystream \* sensor-d 1234 temperature 19.8 15181480106-2

#### Q40. Which code example completes this statement and creates an index for a MongoDB object named restaurants, sorted ascending by the field name?

```
var indexCollection = function(db) {return co(function*() {...});};
```

- %OPTION% `const results = yield db.table('restaurants').createIndex({"name": 1}, null); return results;`
- %OPTION% `const results = yield db.collection('restaurants').createIndex({"name": 0}, null); return results;`
- %OPTION% `const results = yield db.collection('restaurants').createIndex({"name": 1}, null); return results;`
- %OPTION% `const results = yield db.table('restaurants').createIndex({"name": 0}, null); return results;`

#### Q41. Which Cypher code executes the multiquery block?

- %OPTION% A

```
MATCH (c:Company {name: 'Neo4j'}) RETURN c, MATCH (p:Person) WHERE p.name = 'Jennifer' RETURN p,
MATCH (t:Technology)-[:LIKES]-(a:Person {name: 'Jennifer'}) RETURN t.type;
```

- %OPTION% B

```
MATCH (c:Company {name: 'Neo4j'}) RETURN c, MATCH (p:Person) WHERE p.name = 'Jennifer' RETURN p,
MATCH (t:Technology)-[:LIKES]-(a:Person {name: 'Jennifer'}) RETURN t.type
```

- %OPTION% C

```
MATCH (c:Company {name: 'Neo4j'}) RETURN c AND MATCH (p:Person) WHERE p.name = 'Jennifer' RETURN p,
AND MATCH (t:Technology)-[:LIKES]-(a:Person {name: 'Jennifer'}) RETURN t.type;
```

- %OPTION% D

```
MATCH (c:Company {name: 'Neo4j'}) RETURN c;MATCH (p:Person) WHERE p.name = 'Jennifer' RETURN p;
MATCH (t:Technology)-[:LIKES]-(a:Person {name: 'Jennifer'}) RETURN t.type;
```

#### Q42. You need to create a scalable database that supports immutable writes. What do you use?

- %OPTION% A ledger database
- %OPTION% A graph database
- %OPTION% A key-value database
- %OPTION% A columnstore database

#### Q43. You need to create a data store for the catalog for your new ecommerce application. Your company is a startup, so the catalog schema may evolve. Which do you choose?

- %OPTION% Neo4j
- %OPTION% Redis
- %OPTION% MySQL
- %OPTION% MongoDB

#### Q44. You need to select a NoSQL database for heavy aggregate query workloads. Which type do you choose?

- %OPTION% graph
- %OPTION% key-value
- %OPTION% document
- %OPTION% columnstore

#### Q45. You need to select a columnstore database that enforce built-in data types. You want to add indexes to improve performance for known workloads. Which do you choose?

- %OPTION% Cassandra
- %OPTION% Bigtable
- %OPTION% Redis
- %OPTION% HBase

#### Q46. In DynamoDB, the partition key and sort key are also known as which type of attributes?

- %OPTION% range, hash
- %OPTION% primary, range
- %OPTION% hash, range
- %OPTION% range, secondary

#### Q47. What is a popular, open-source key-value store database?

- %OPTION% MongoDB
- %OPTION% Redis
- %OPTION% MySQL
- %OPTION% Cassandra

#### Q48. You need to create a scalable database to store and query JSON data. What do you use?

- %OPTION% a relational database
- %OPTION% a document database
- %OPTION% a graph database
- %OPTION% a ledger database

[store and query JSON](https://aws.amazon.com/nosql/document/#:~:text=The%20document%20database%20defined,use%20in%20their%20application%20code.)

en.TITLE: Skill Assessments Quizzes
en.DESC:
Collection of questions and answers on different subjects aimed to help
you test your knowledge before an important job interview!

Data from __data__. UI by __bandinopla__

es.TITLE: Questionarios de evaluación de habilidades
es.DESC:
Colección de preguntas y respuestas sobre diferentes temas orientadas a
ayudarte a testear tu conocimiento antes de una importante entrevista de trabajo! 

Datos de __data__. UI por __bandinopla__
